subject: Re: Swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: ... it s a ... Thanks for the prompt reply. Why do u say that most people do not use the swingui in the main method, how else do they use it? Is it a bad
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> parul_49 wrote:
>
> >Hi,
> >I am trying to write Junit test for some of the classes.
> >This is my code :
> > public static Test suite()
> > {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(GetBanBillSummaryTest.class);
> > return suite;
> > }
> >
> > public static void main(String args[])
> > {
> > //junit.textui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> > junit.swingui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> > }
> >
>
> Most folks generally don't use the SwingUI in the main method, so
it's a
> little different.
>
> This will work:
>
> junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(Your.class);
>
> Mike



Thanks for the prompt reply.
Why do u say that most people do not use the swingui in the main
method, how else do they use it? Is it a bad practise to use it?
